Articles.Content:
1.0 rendered ALL my ships in orbit incapable of reentry. I had a backup 0.90 just for stuff like this, but I think steam deleted it or something. ![:mad:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_angry.gif) The worst part is, I can't dock in orbit. My ships don't have docking ports anyway.![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

I would appreciate it if someone could email 0.25 or 0.90 and tell me how not to get this stuff deleted. My email is [\[email protected\]](/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection#735644311c03071a1c1d564437). I don't check it much, so could they also message me in this forum?
Unfortunately, I'm not sure if sending other people copies of KSP is legal. ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

> 
> 1.0 rendered ALL my ships in orbit incapable of reentry. I had a backup 0.90 just for stuff like this, but I think steam deleted it or something. ![:mad:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_angry.gif) The worst part is, I can't dock in orbit. My ships don't have docking ports anyway.![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

Steam can't delete it if it's not in Steam's folder structure. Are you sure you didn't just misplace it?

There's an option to opt into the 'previous stable release' in the Beta section for steam, btw. That \*should\* put you back to 0.90. IN theory. Haven't tested..

> 
> Unfortunately, I'm not sure if sending other people copies of KSP is legal. ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

It is absolutely **not** legal. Do **NOT** do.
